skill.name: chronicle-remote-summarizer
skill.description: Automate cross-system summarization workflow for Chronicle sessions. Export sessions from remote systems (like FreeBSD) and import/summarize on local machine with Gemini API. Use when you have sessions on a system without Gemini API access and need to summarize them on another machine.
skill.summary: Automate cross-system summarization workflow for Chronicle sessions. Export sessions from remote sys...
skill.author: ChandlerHardy

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill describing a legitimate cross-system workflow using SSH and Chronicle's built-in import/export functionality. All 154 static findings are false positives from shell command examples in documentation, not actual executable code. No malicious patterns confirmed after evaluation.

content.user_title: Summarize Chronicle sessions across remote systems
content.value_statement: Your Chronicle sessions on remote systems without Gemini API can now be summarized on your local machine. This workflow automates the SSH-based transfer and cleanup process.
actual_capabilities: Export Chronicle sessions via SSH from remote systems
Import and summarize sessions using local Gemini API
Send summaries back to original remote systems
Support for FreeBSD, Linux, and macOS systems
limitations: Requires SSH access between local and remote systems
Gemini API key needed on local machine only
Chronicle must be installed on both systems
Large sessions may take 30-60 seconds to process

use_cases.title: Summarize dev sessions from FreeBSD
use_cases.description: Export sessions from FreeBSD development server to macOS laptop for AI summarization, then import summaries back.

use_cases.title: Cross-platform session management
use_cases.description: Manage Chronicle sessions across different development environments without configuring API keys on each system.

use_cases.title: Remote troubleshooting documentation
use_cases.description: Document troubleshooting sessions performed on remote servers by summarizing them locally for team sharing.

prompt_templates.title: Basic remote summarization
prompt_templates.prompt: I have session 7 on my FreeBSD machine that needs summarization. The FreeBSD system doesn't have Gemini API configured. Can you help me summarize it on this local machine and send the summary back?

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to summarize sessions 10, 11, and 12 from my remote development server. Can you process them all and import the summaries back?

prompt_templates.title: Configure remote system
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me configure my FreeBSD development server for remote summarization. The hostname is dev.example.com and chronicle is installed in ~/.local/bin/

prompt_templates.title: Debug workflow issues
prompt_templates.prompt: The one-line SSH command is hanging when trying to summarize session 15 from remote. Can you use the manual 3-step workflow instead?

output_examples.input: Summarize session 7 from my FreeBSD dev machine
output: Importing and summarizing locally with Gemini

best_practices: Configure remote systems once in Chronicle config for automatic command construction
Use --quiet flag to suppress status messages when piping commands
Save intermediate JSON files when debugging with the 3-step workflow
anti_patterns: Running summarization on systems without Gemini API configured
Manually extracting JSON from verbose output instead of using --quiet
Keeping temporary sessions after summarization instead of using auto-cleanup

faq.question: Which systems are compatible with this workflow?
faq.answer: Any Unix-like system with SSH access and Chronicle installed, including FreeBSD, Linux, and macOS.

faq.question: What are the size limits for remote sessions?
faq.answer: No hard limits. Large sessions are automatically chunked into 10,000 line segments for processing.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my development scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflow outputs clean JSON suitable for scripting and automation pipelines.

faq.question: Is my data safe during transfer?
faq.answer: Yes, data travels over SSH encryption. Temporary sessions are auto-deleted after summarization.

faq.question: The SSH command hangs, what should I do?
faq.answer: Use the manual 3-step workflow: export to file, process locally, then import the summary back.

faq.question: How does this compare to regular Chronicle summarization?
faq.answer: It's identical summarization, just across systems. The temporary session ensures no pollution between databases.
